qas.question: Why did agriculture become so significant for Armenia's economy?
Was agriculture more important before or after Armenia left the Soviet Union?
How much of total employment did agriculture account for at the end of the 1990s?
How much of the GDP has agriculture accounted for most recently?

context: Agriculture accounted for less than 20% of both net material product and total employment before the dissolution of the Soviet Union in 1991. <a1_0>After<a1_0/> independence, the importance of agriculture in the economy increased markedly, its share at the end of the 1990s rising to more than 30% of GDP and more than <a2_0>40%<a2_0/> of total employment. This increase in the importance of agriculture was attributable to <a0_0>food security needs<a0_0/> of the population in the face of uncertainty during the first phases of transition and the collapse of the non-agricultural sectors of the economy in the early 1990s. As the economic situation stabilized and growth resumed, the share of agriculture in GDP dropped to slightly over <a3_0>20%<a3_0/> (2006 data), although the share of agriculture in employment remained more than 40%.
